revised_title: Specific Buoyancy of Cork in Different Waters: Experiments and Findings
tldr: The author, John Wilkinson, conducted a series of experiments to determine the specific buoyancy of cork in different types of water, including fresh water and salt water. He found that salt water provides more buoyancy to the cork than fresh water. The experiments also showed that the absorption of water by the cork changes its buoyancy, and the author suggests that the assertion that human bodies are specifically lighter than their respective volumes of water may not be entirely accurate.
